content.question: Which of the following claims can be made about African American political participation?

choices.label: African American women competed against African American men in state elections during the late nineteenth century.
African American men led efforts to extend suffrage to women during the late nineteenth century.
African American women used grassroots methods to advocate for political rights during the early twentieth century.
African American men and women used their positions in elected offices to pass civil rights legislation during the early twentieth century.

content.answer: African American women used grassroots methods to advocate for political rights during the early twentieth century.
